question: <katex>$\int\frac{1}{1+3~\sin^{2}x+8~\cos^{2}x}dx=$</katex>
explanation: Divide Num/Den by <katex>$\cos^2 x$</katex>: <katex>$\int \frac{\sec^2 x}{\sec^2 x + 3\tan^2 x + 8} dx$</katex>.
<katex>$\sec^2 x = 1+\tan^2 x$</katex>. Denom: <katex>$1+\tan^2 x + 3\tan^2 x + 8 = 4\tan^2 x + 9$</katex>.
<katex>$\int \frac{\sec^2 x}{(2\tan x)^2 + 3^2} dx$</katex>. Let <katex>$2\tan x = t$</katex>.
